content.detailedDescription: This was some time during november during 1993.It was early evening and my girlfriend at the time was working late on a project for the lexington high school yearbook.I was waiting outside to give her a ride home.Behind the school was a practise field for the marching band and overlooking the field was a 20' tall observation tower for the band director.I decided to climb up the tower, just goofing off and killing time. i laid down on my back once i was on top of the tower to look at the stars.It was a clear night.As i was star gazing, i noticed a tiny light approximately the same size and brightness as most of the stars in the sky.It was moving across the sky at a steady rate.It was too far off and too small to be something in our atmosphere and i concluded it must be a satellite in orbit.I remember thinking how neat it was to happen to see a satellite by chance with the naked eye.I continued to watch the light as it moved across the sky for a minute or two, when it suddenly shot off at an accelerated rate at a 90* angle to its previous trajectory.It did not increase in brightness as if it were falling or coming closer, but seemed to disappear out into space within a matter of seconds.My reaction at the time was literally, "holy s**t!What was that?"over the years, i have never been able to come up with a satisfactory theory why a man made object would suddenly change direction and speed like that.If it was a meteor or space debris in orbit reflecting moonlight and collided with another object to send it speeding off like that, why was the other object not visible?I did not see it make contact with anything before it shot off into space.My only conclusion is that it was intelligently controlled.I have never forgotten it or told anyone other than members of my family.���
content.summary: Small star-size light in motion suddenly changing direction and accelerating.

content.detailedDescription: I was in my kitchen and look't out the window saw two airplanes flew from est to west in ca. 30.000 feet. than i saw in the middle the silver shine object ca. 20.000 feed its look like a cigar shaped object, flighting from west to east with no stream , flight at normal speed like a normal airplane than is disappeared in a second in a different direction .
content.summary: Long siver, like a cigar very high round 24000 feet.

content.detailedDescription:
I remember everything accept the exact date, accpet in was in 1996. i lived with my parents at the time and i was watching jay leno, so it was just after 11:30pm and power went out. i was the only one up. so i went to the kitchen to get some water and looked out the windows and saw a light flying around. did not think much of it. helicopter probably. so went back to my room and power was restored minutes later, as i comfortable again the power went out a second time. i was already into ufo's too so that got me worried and excited as i went back to the kitchen and there was light, which i could tell the shape at that time still. so back to my room and for the 3rd time the power goes out. that's it i go back to the kitchen to observe. the light seems to be coming my way along our main road called henderson, so lost site of it and walked outside under out walkway i froze, this huge object, could of been the size of the space shuttle or a blimp, but it was lit up like a christmas tree and not one sound came from it. i kept thinking it was military only because it was flying right in directon macdill air force base. i was once stationed at ft. bragg and saw all kinds of military helecopters flying at night and this could of been what i saw. i just watched it slowly cruise by and it went on it's marry way to the south flying just above tree level. i told some people at work the next day and got laughed at. so i just deciced to tell my closet friends afterwards. later on in the year though i was at my friends house and watching channel 8 news and they showed short clips that years ufo sightings and someone filmed what i saw. i have watched tons of ufo documentrys and searched the interent high and low for what i saw and the attached pic is the comes the closet. would love to hear back if you guys have heard of this one.

mark
content.summary: Looked a little like something out of star wars, the imperial ship.

content.detailedDescription:
I was in my backyard doing some light watering in my veggie garden bed. i was facing west/northwest and i looked up into the sky directly above my head.  to my amazement i saw a bright white object hovering in the sky, very high.  it was not moving much so it wasn't a plane.  it could not have been a bird, it was up very high and it wasn't circling the way predatory birds do.  it just continued to hover over the area, it seemed to be turning slightly but not moving much.  then after a few minutes it slowly began to move toward the mountains in a northwesterly direction.  i kept watching it until it finally moved away from view.  there was no sound, no flashing lights, no contrail of course.  it was not floating.
i felt like it was doing some observation, got what it needed and left.
content.summary: White sphere-like object hovering over aurora/denver area at noon.

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my was to work at 6:45am on april 2, 2009. traveling north on rt 839 in cottage hill near new bethlehem pa. when i crested the hill i noticed a long line flying low near the trees off in the distance, at first it looked like a line of geese heading west, but i realized it was not in a v shape and it was one solid object. it captured my attention as i continued to drive north and soon i realized it was now heading towards me. i found a place to pull over just past a local farm, when i looked up to see it again, it was 100 feet from me approx 250 feet in the air, i had to lean forward and look up from the dash of my vehicle to see the top of the object which had gone from horizontal to vertical and was now hovering in it's place. the object seemed to be black / gray in color and looked like a large cylinder. it was like a plane fuselage but not smooth...It seemed like someone had crummpled up aluminum foil then tried to smooth it out again (crinkled), although it had some smooth areas. there was a pinkish light at the top and bottom and it remained staionary like this for nearly 5 minutes. i noticed someone's headights behind me and saw them turn into the farm and i contemplated flagging them down to ask if he saw it too. when i looked again, i saw that the object was beginning to move away. it returned to the horizontal position and as it moved away it looked as though it was shimmering or moving all along it's body, eventhough it moved very fluidly and smoothly through the air. it continued west in the direction it was headed originally and i watched until it disappeared in the distance.
when i got to work, i called the local airport to see if it they had gotten clearence from someone flying in the area. they seemed to be very interested in what i saw but had not heard of anyone in that area. i called the state police to see if anyone else had called in a strange object flying in the area. i was told no one had called in, but they also seemed very interested in what i saw.
the next day, i was still trying to find someone who had seen what i did. so i called the farm owner and talked to a friend of mine, i asked if he saw this object and he told me that he hadn't seen it but he knew who had. that person contacted me later and confirmed he saw the same object i did, only he described it as looking like a very large vehicle standing on end, and he thought it looked blue, red and white (although it could have been reflecting the sun rise at his angle). i got confirmation but we still can't figure out what we saw. there have been no other sightings reported as of yet and no one can tell us what it was.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
content.summary: 300 ft. cyclindrical, low flying, slow moving object hovered 100 ft from me. first flew horizontal then hovered vertically before leaving.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving south on madison st on my way to an appointment at the hospital on that same street street. i was just a few yards from the entrance to the hospital parking lot when i thought to look up. recently, i have become very interested in the ufo phenomenon and have been trying to pay more attention to the skies.

i looked up through my windshield looking south. it was then that i spotted what at first appeared to be a plane. but, the more i looked at this object, the more i became aware that it could not be a plane. 
the object was silver in color and reflecting the sun. it was heading from east to west, toward the gulf of mexico.
it's difficult for me to judge the distance from the ground that the object was flying because the whole sighting only lasted about 10 seconds. though, it did appear to be at an average height of normal small aircraft. 
when i first noticed the object, i initially thought it could be a smaller plane. it appeared to be larger than if it were a commercial aircraft due the altitude in which commercial aircraft are normally seen.
it's also hard to judge the size of the object since i was not able to determine its altitude.

as i watched the object i leaned back a little so that i could view it through the sunshade section of my windshield that runs across the top. i did this because the glare of the sun reflecting off the object was very intense. it was at that moment that i noticed i could not see as much of the object as i could just a second before. i then leaned forward to again view it through the unshaded part of my window. 
that was when the object appeared to be dematerializing right before my eyes!
at first it seemed as though half the object had vanished. as i watched in amazement, driving very slowly down the road, the object became completely invisible. 

there were no clouds in the immediate vicinity of this thing so it didn't go behind them. i first thought it might be a plane but, i don't recall seeing very many silver, shiny airplanes. i live in airport community, so i see a variety of airplanes regularly. and i can say without a doubt that this thing did not get lost from my line of sight, fly behind a cloud or anything logical. it simply vanished into thin air as i watched it!

i stopped looking for this thing so that i could park my car in the parking lot of the hospital. once i had gotten out of my vehicle, i immediately began searching the sky for any trace of what i had witnessed. if it had been a plane, it should have still been in my field of view. as i looked all around the sky above me and in the area the object appeared to be heading, i could see nothing even remotely resembling this thing.
i searched the skies until i had to get inside the building in order to make my appointment.

this is the very first time that i have seen something that defies explanation or logic. in fact, this is the very first ufo experience of my life.
content.summary: Object  disappeared!

content.detailedDescription: I was plying frisbe with my cousins and i saw this circular object moving down showing me the full circle, and i thought of well its a plane or something and sometimes it would flash kindof like when the sun hits metal. so me and my cousin where looking for it and it was on the other side across from where it first was, and this time it was moving up and still showing all of the circe and repeditly flashed it had no shape of any aircraft and my cousin and me think it is possibly a ufo and i would like to share this experience with the rest of you.
content.summary: A disk shaped object showing me the full circle.

content.detailedDescription: I saw a strobing white ufo from 2017-2018 on april, 7, 2009. it looked to be at about 2000��� and was around 470 and the outskirts of lakewood, co. i first noticed the object as it looked like the aircraft on approach to dia. it was stationary against the mountains in the west. however, the object did not change in altitude,  or course over the 2 minutes that i saw it. it was strobing fairly rapidly, like what stan romanek had described in his observations around this area.  it was white and then had a couple of bursts of small red orbs coming from it.  it then just vanished from sight after a minute of observation.  i have seen objects similar to this about once a month around lakewood since fall 2008.  i am sure there are several every night in this area, but i only see them every month.
content.summary: Strobing light with red orbs coming out of it.

content.detailedDescription:
I can send you the pictures.  i copied them on a cd.  to what address do i send them?  (i will try to send them to you via "attachments" thing below.)

on december 9, 2008, there was a fire in thousand oaks.  i went there and took pictures.  i got a "shakey hands" warning from my camera, and i could see on the display that the pictures were out of focus.

i didn't have much interest in them.  lately i felt a need to get my personal pictures off my computer at work.  i was going to burn them on a cd.  i looked through the pictures, wanted to delete any duplicate shots.  when i saw the picture, i was puzzled.  i can not imagine what makes the appearance of these lights up in the sky.

on the day that i took the pictures, my first vantage point was a dud.  so i hopped in my car and drove around until i found a better view.  even at that, trees were in the way ... by the time i found a good spot, it was getting late, losing sunlight.  

i remember the flames of the fire suddenly seemed to burst up.  it was like when you light a gas stove and the fire erupts with a burst.  the fire did a burst; then it quickly fizzled out to glowing embers.  "oh well," i thought, "show's over."

maybe you can determine a logical explanation for the lights.  or at least rule out, "dirty lense, etc."
content.summary: 8 lights.  5 red and 3 white.

content.detailedDescription:
As a boy i was raised in the united states air force, and growing up for those 18 years inside the military had placed me in stations that defy common knowledge, as well as having served my own tour ��� so there aren���t any man-made craft - ground, air or otherwise, which i am not very familiar with.

date/time:		december 31st, 2005, starting at approximately 2400 hours (12:00 midnight est, new year���s early morning 2006)

location:		east central florida, united states, on the atlantic ocean and within relatively close proximity to the space coast, nasa, and launch central.

it was at this time i found myself spending some time out in an isolated county operated campground in east central florida. during this time, the weather was very mild and comfortable. being late december here on the southeast coast, the atmosphere was completely still and clear, and offered an incredible view of the night sky, practically unphased by local lighting.

the late evenings here with these crisp clear night skies, make it very easy to pinpoint any movement from satellites, high flying aircraft, or even the space station if it was within your latitude at the time. i especially look for extremely high-altitude military aircraft, whose height, course and speeds are unmistakable.

it was approximately at the time mentioned above that i began to notice the absence of aircraft, all of them, everywhere and in every direction. i found this puzzling at that moment as in this part of the world private and commercial aircraft are constantly in motion in all directions, and at all hours of the day and night.

i was casually viewing to a south easterly direction upwards of about 40-50 degrees when i noticed a movement in an otherwise standstill sky. it appeared in the exact direction i was looking. a bright spot, very high up, maybe even at the upper reaches of the atmosphere. it moved in a straight line downward from its upper position of appearance (from my perspective), not varying at any angle whatsoever, and appeared not having what one would expect to be a reentry burn if indeed it was reentering the atmosphere. the motion was emphatically too slow for its altitude and course. i discounted the possibility of a reentry vehicle at this moment as the speed and lack of burn plume was inconsistent with such.

i visually followed this object in its path for about 10 to 15 seconds until it appeared to come to a halt. it was still situated fairly high up (in altitude) but did not move any further in any direction. in fact, it did not move at all. it remained completely stationary in its current position and altitude. its brightness remained constant, so its position point of reference could be maintained.

suddenly (within about 5 seconds) there appeared a second spot of equally bright light in relative close proximity to the original though at about a 35 degree retrograde angle towards the east in regards to altitude and position. this second object though was not stationary. it began to move at a rapid pace in smooth arcs of varying degrees and in varying directions. i am almost afraid to say that the movements of this second object were not possible, given the altitude, speed, directional changes, and apparent proximity to the original object, it was almost a dance of light.

almost as suddenly as this second object appeared it too halted dead in its position and altitude, at about the original position which it appeared. i would approximate the time frame of original appearance of the second object to this stationary position as about 10-20 seconds.

it was at this point that what happened next will require considerably more detail in order to make sure this is clear.

there appeared an intensely bright object, of a brightness magnitude 5 to 10 times greater than the original two objects, and which appeared to come from out of or below the second object. it slowly appeared to fall to earth with slowly increasing speed and in a trajectory which would have placed it directly off the coast and somewhat south from my current position. this motion seemed free fall in nature, though may have been powered flight. it maintained a consistent brightness the entire way down before it disappeared beyond the trees that obscured any view of where it may have impacted, though i suspect its impact point would place it well into the atlantic ocean, probably several considerable miles off the coast. there was no vapor trail or burn plume. the two original objects remained without moving in their current positions. i think the key here is the ���without moving��� part.

the time frame of the third object descent from the second object to surface would be roughly 10-15 seconds.

within about 5 to 10 seconds after the third object had disappeared behind the trees, there now appeared two united states military aircraft at afterburner speed and tree top level which came directly past my position in a direct course towards the apparent point of impact of the third object. these fighter aircraft came from a due west position from where i was standing. they too disappeared past the tree line heading in that easterly course.

within about 10 to 15 seconds of the disappearance of the jet aircraft, there came (as near as i can recall) two military helicopters from the due north which were at approximately 500 feet altitude and changed course once they reached the same course position of the aircraft and headed in the same easterly direction.

once the two choppers had likewise disappeared beyond the tree line, and after approximately 10 to 15 seconds the two original objects maintaining their fixed positions still to this point began to slowly move in unison and gaining speed upwards and outwards from the atmosphere until they disappeared into what i can only guess is the night shadow of the earth. their course upwards was likewise a straight line.

remaining in my current position throughout the entire night and into the next day, i never saw any of the military aircraft return.

(1)	if these united states military aircraft were actually ordered to this event, then someone somewhere knows why;

(2)	if statement (1) is true, then the event itself was ���known��� in advance. taking into consideration originating base of operations, flight time, and speed, it is very unlikely that these aircraft were ���already on some mission which coincided with this event���;

(3)	if statement (2) is true, then one can only surmise that the united states, and ergo the united states military are fully aware of what transpired before, during and after this event.

in the following days, weeks and months, i combed the local newspapers and a myriad of internet sources for any word of possible naval activity off the east coast of florida. not even so much as a transient or vague offer of a recovery mission or exercise could be found. 

i very casually asked a few friends who fished the local seas if they knew of or saw any naval vessels or unknown or unfamiliar ships out towards the horizon during this time, to which none were ever reported. 

in conclusion, i personally found this entire ���show��� as a happy new year gesture, though admittedly not quite the new york times square ball drop version. 

cheers.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 3 objects of unknown origin, 2 military fighters, 2 military helicopters.

content.detailedDescription:
Please review attached photo's #1 and #2.  i'd be interested in knowing your assesment of what i'm seeing.

you can reply to: [cms/tg/pid]

thank you,

[cms/tg/pid]
content.summary: Google earth photos- holloman afb, nm - ufo's?

content.detailedDescription: Me and my son were driving home from his work and was almost home and he heard a very loud rumbling and we looked up to see what it was and we seen 2 lights and right over head. sometime there were 3 lights and it made a triangle shape. but the weird thing was it as clear we could see everything on the other side of the craft like stars so it must have been invisible compleltely tranparent. it just flew away towards down town l.A.
content.summary: Clear with lights on the ends 2 and sometime 3 making a triangle.

content.detailedDescription: I walk the(upton)beach every morning. a cold front moved in yesterday and it's very windy and cool.The beach is empty except for a couple people.My friend and i initially just noticed the large crater it was remarkable in size and configuration but i saw that it just looked like a big hole to him and i didn't let on to my suspicions. we walked more had breakfast and walked back. the wind was blowing almost too hard to walk but more people were on the beach. some folks went swimming and decided the "big hole" was a great place to put their stuff so it wouldn't blow away. by afternoon i would expect the craters to have blown nearly away or maybe not.This is the first time i have seen these craters here, ever.
content.summary: seven imprints in sand, middle imprint 12ft wide 3-4ft deep, three imprints on either side about 2 ft wide and two feet deep. there a small trench around a slight mound in the middle of each crater.

content.detailedDescription: I was indoors watching television when i heard a sound. it was almost subsonic as i think i felt it more than i heard it. i am not sure i can find the words to describe the sound. i had heard this sound maybe 6-10 times since i've lived here, but have never seen anything to identify what it could have been. this particular evening i heard the sound, asked others in the house if they heard it, then went outside and looked up. above my house was a large, maybe 20-30 feet across, glowing circle. it wasn't emitting light but seemed to be lit from within. after about 3 or 4 seconds it went straight up. i saw the light go from a large circle to a very small circle then disappear. i just stood there trying to figure it all out. i could not see the entire circle so i am assuming it was just a circle, because it was directly over my house and i could just see about 2/3 of it from where i was standing beside my house. i now want to know why? i have always been interested in sightings but never had one like this before. now i think i am just more confused then before.
content.summary: Glowing orb hovering over my house.

content.detailedDescription: I was a cadet riding with the pickens county sherffs dept while i was a junor in high shool. we recevide a call about strange light that we responded to,when we arrive the deputy and i did observe a circlar shape object that contantly changed colors but made no sound. it was located over an open corn field . we drove very slowly and the craft started moving with us, it was 100 to 150 feet away from us. it was a clear night with a full moon, so we had a very good look at this object. this whent on for about 6 min and then suddenly, it jumped about 3 miles away and then, made an upward motion and vanished toword space. i went to call in and report what we had seen an the deputy told me not to because there was no way we could prove it. i was told by the deupty that they had receive many calls but was not allowed to report for fear of being fired.
content.summary: Lights moving in a circle motion , changing colors

content.detailedDescription: From 2 miles south of plevna (driving from south to north), mt my wife and i saw a fireball streaking down at a steep angle.  it was a bit north of plevna and was about half way up the horizon.  it appeared for 1 to 2 seconds, bright flash, the fireball, a minimal fire streak with it.  it was bright, then dim, then bright, then dim, then gone at about 1/4 of the horizon.  we both said wow, meteor. we were excited to both have seen the "meteor".  about 5-10 seconds later the same object went shooting back skyward along about the same line it took coming down.  it appeared for less then a second, brightly, then was gone.  it was really moving at a high rate of speed in both directions, nearly as fast going back up as it was coming down.  it disappeared after that, we spent about 20 minutes watching to see if it would show up again. once it shot back up we both knew right then and there that it couldn't be a "meteor". we both thought we spotted a ufo and were excited about it. we even tried to mentally ask it to reappear. unfortunately that did not happen.
content.summary: Fireball streaking toward ground, disappeared for 10 seconds, then shot back skyward.

content.detailedDescription: i was looking up at the stars in the sky when all of the sudden two stars started moveing both started from the same area one went down in the sky to the edge of the sky  at a speed slower than a shooting star and faster and higher up than an airplane.The other one darted around for a minute or so then stopped.This was no airplane or satelite.It moved fast.And lit up at the edge of the sky then dissapeared.
content.summary: Two star like objects moveing in formation then darting off

content.detailedDescription: At 4:15 p.M. i was driving westbound on belleview avenue and noticed an object in the sky. it was very stark against the clear, blue sky and that's what made me notice it. when i first saw it, it seemed quite far away, but drifted east toward where i was. at first, i thought it was a helicopter monitoring rush-hour traffic, but it's movements were not like a helicopter and when i got a better look at it as it came closer, it was obvious it was not a helicopter. it was disc-shaped, but somewhat morphic - it seemed to alternate in shape and it seemed to be drifting with and/or coasting on the wind and it was very fluid in its movements and covered some distance very quickly. it was approximately 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile away when i got a fairly good look at it. it was difficult to keep my eye on it, however, as i was driving and went under the i-25/belleview bridge. it was traveling in a ssw direction and as i continued on belleview, i pulled off the avenue (street/junction just before monaco & belleview, adjacent to office park). it didn't look like anything i'd seen before, and i know this will sound weird, but its movements reminded me of a dance ... its movements were just very fluid and graceful. but it was not a bird! that i know for certain! i thought maybe it could be a balloon of some sort, but its outer shell was definitely metallic, but not shiny, like mylar or polished silver ... it was more like a gun-metal gray, muted but finished enough to catch the sun's reflection. it rose and fell in altitude as it continued ssw, changing color from the sun's reflection (i think), then continued to rise in altitude before i lost sight of it. it was a clear afternoon, no clouds, but a slight, smoggy haze, and the afternoon sun was very bright.
content.summary: Disc-like sighting at belleview & i-25.

content.detailedDescription: As pilot in command of a medevac uh-60a for a medevac helicopter company i had transfered controls to my copilot to take a break from flying as we were on what is called a "milk run" from al asad airbase to balad airbase and back to al asad. these milk runs are done either really late at night or very early in the morning. flight took place may 15th 2005 aprox 2:30 am as written in my logbook. we had completed most of our flight and were in between ar ramadi and lake tharthar heading west towards al asad. flight was under anvis 6s. shortly after the transfere of the flight controls i looked up through what we call the "green house" a plexi-glass window above the pilot and copilot stations in the helicopter and located a triangular object with five lights along the point and forward portion of the object. object was observed moving at high rate of speed coming from the south heading towards the north at what i would estimate fl300. object stayed in sight under night vision goggles for approx 1 min then went out of sight as we continued flying west. we were at an altitude of 300ft as night restrictions in iraq apply. once we landed i took a look at the daily flight scheduel for all multi-national forces in iraq to make sure what i observed was not an aircraft, no aircraft were operating in the area at the time of the sighting. i did not mention the incedent to any other pilots from fear of ridicule. i had always thought that as a pilot if i saw a ufo i would tell everyone but when it happened i could not bring myself to speak of it. now i want to know whats going on in the skies over iraq as other soldiers have seen strange phenomena under nvgs.
content.summary: Triangle ufo spotted under nvg.

content.detailedDescription:
This is in regards to report 16425. i saw a very similar effect in the sky northwest of lake elsinore, ca. several star-like objects (very bright) appeared about 15 degrees above the horizon. constantly moving, they would appear very bright, then fade and disappear, then get bright again. 
i was able to use binoculars to get a fairly good look at the objects. they looked like pelicans- they were very far away, and i'd estimate their altitude to be around 3500 feet. they would slowly circle- i could easily see them when they flew north, as they were banking to the left; the sunlight reflected off of them brilliantly. as they turned toward me, they became almost invisible, then would get brighter and brighter as they completed their circles. i observed them for several minutes. i had to confirm with my wife (life-long resident and bird watcher) and father-in-law (pilot) that pelicans can get that high. both confirmed that they absolutely can, and are common in this area. 
the birds were so far away that without binoculars, it just looked like a slowly moving, tight formation of intensely bright objects that disappear and reappear without rhyme or reason.
content.summary: Several star-like objects east of lake elsinore.

content.detailedDescription: On family vacation in palm desert.  out for a walk alone on the sidewalks near a golf course.  not a cloud in the sky; sun fairly high and bright. i heard a loud commercial plane overhead and looked up to see it.  in the far background, behind the plane, i saw a bright glint of sunlight off an object.  i focused on the object and it was a speck of light.  i believe it was north to north east of my position in palm desert, very high in the sky, likely 75 degrees or so above a horizontal sight line.  i immediately thought of a supernova, bright enough to see in the daylight.  i continued to view this spot, thinking i was in on a spectacular event.  i then sensed that the object was moving very slowly in the sky.  i move a few feet down the sidewalk to put a tree, about 20 feet high, within my frame of view.  the wind was very light to non-existent, so the branches on the tree were not moving appreciably.  when viewed next to a limb of this tree, the object definitely was moving as it slipped behind the limb.  i moved back clear of the limb and reacquired the object.  it stopped moving, hovered for a few seconds, then reversed course, not quite 180 degrees.  it moved in this new direction for a few seconds, then started moving in various directions, almost as if doing figure eights.  at that time, a golf course worker in a golf cart came by.  i asked him to look at the object to confirm it.  when we both looked up again, neither of us could see it.  feeling slightly foolish, i continued my walk.  i could not help looking up as i walked, however, hoping to see it again.  a minute or so after i starting walking again, i saw the object at about the same spot in the sky.  this time, however, there were at least five other similar objects in a loose configuration with each other.  i blinked my eyes and rubbed them to make sure i was not seeing things.  i was not.  the objects persisted, moving together in a direction i perceived to be west to north west.  two of the objects started to move close to each other, but then moved away just before converging.  i continued to watch these objects move slowly until they simply dissolved from view, as if suddenly moving directly away from me out of my range of acuity.  there were no contrails associated with these objects, even though i saw several high-flying commercial craft trailing contrails in all parts of the sky.  i only saw one glint of sunlight, off the original object, but it was bright enough to be an unmistakeable reflection of sunlight.  i considered the objects to be balloons, but could not explain the irregular, seemingly controlled movements of the first object that i spotted and the actions of the two other objects closing with each other and then separating.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Daytime stars at very high altitude.

content.detailedDescription: I was at work at the exxon-mobil refinery, a crew of about 6 or so carpenters was dismantling a scaffold on the east coke heater.I was in the middle on a passing chain when we stopped for a few minutes to take a break. i was about 40 feet in the air on a scaffold deck and was just kind of looking at the sky when i noticed a vulture circling. as i was watching the bird, i noticed behind it and behind a passing cloud, an object that was cylindrical and sat perfectly still in an otherwise very windy sky. as i watched, it moved right and left very ridgidly and i could see it glimmer slightly.It was mostly dark in color but when it moved, it would glint off the sun alittle. i watched it for about 10 minutes and it moved to the west very rapidly in a straight line, turned at a 90 degree angle, went straight up in the sky and disappeared. i kept looking to see if it would come back and about 15 minutes later, i saw it again over to the east of the refinery, repeating the moves it had done before. this time it started to move southwest against the prevailing winds, it picked up speed very rapidly and was gone in an instant. i told a good friend of mine what i saw, and he said he believed me. later as we were back in our material yard on the north side of the plant,he (brian),said to me that he had just seen something similar to what i had just seen on the north side of arsenal road, hovering over the desplaines river. it hovered and disappeared after a cloud passed it. i know this object was no aircraft becaused it stayed perfectly still in a very windy sky, moved very ridgidly, accelerated very fast and manuevered in 90 angles. i called mufon the next day and left a voicemail about what i had saw, but never got any response. this object appeared to be surveying the construction that was going on at the refinery. it was observed by me and my friend in three directions, directly near the new constuction project.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Saw a cylinder-shaped object twice moving erratically and disappearing.

content.detailedDescription:
Great sunny day with no clouds in brooklyn.
i took several pics from sunset park because i wanted to make a panoramic picture.
then when i downloaded on my computer and adjusted the contrast, i noticed this kind of disc.
even without correcting the contrast, you can see it.
i don't know why there is this on my pic.
content.summary: I didn't notice anything when i took the picture.

content.detailedDescription:
Standing outside waiting for my daughter's singing lesson to be done at a private home. very quiet neighborhood on a hill. listening to evening bird calls, very quiet. object was luminous and orb shaped. came over the house across the street (to the north)and passed overhead without a sound and continued towards the south.
straight trajectory, very slow moving, silent. i watched until it disappeared from my view behind another house.
there were no wings, blades, or protuberances, and it did not change shape or color. it was not a lantern or a helicopter (in my opinion).
waited for another 20 minutes but it did not return.
content.summary: Spherical object, silent, passed directlly overhead at 500'.

content.detailedDescription: At 1:23am 4/4/09 my 17 year old son and i were pulling out of our driveway to pick up my other son.  as we driving down the street heading east a huge bright light came up above the tree line to our north.  we both turned and saw a large orange light just above the trees it was not round nor square nor oval, i could not make out the shape as it was so bright.  my first thought was than we were being bombed, but then i realized that it was going up not coming down. my son is yelling "what is that"? we turned the car north and sped to where it was, just before we got near it started moving east across the sky. my son is telling me to call the police. i told him they would think i was crazy. we could not hear anything but as it started moving east it looked as if it had a net over the top of it.  just above the orange light something was visible but not lit up and this was what appeared to have a huge net over it.  you could see something under the net.  the only way to discribe it is like a huge mobile home in the sky with the back of it having large bright orange lights brighter than any light i have ever seen.  my son and i were both scared. he told me to give him my cell phone so he could get a picture of it before it moved too far away.  the picture was taken on my cell phone and the object was much closer to us then it appears on the picture.  the object went east and in less than a minute after taking the picture we could no longer see it.  we tried calling my younger son's cell phone several times and he did not answer.  i really feared that he had been taken by this strange object as he always answers for me.  my 17 year old was saying the same thing to me.  we drove the 5-6 blocks back to our house and i pulled in the drive way.  my son went in to get his cell to see if his brother would answer for him.  as i sat in the driveway the object appeared to be coming back toward us.  my son saw it as he came out of the house and ran to the car yelling "it is coming back chase it". we pulled out of the driveway and just before it looked to have reached the edge of town our visiblity was blocked by trees for a split second and then it vanished. we noticed about 5 minutes later that a sheriff patrol had came in to town.  i think that he was there because he had seen the light also.
content.summary: Large bright orange object came up from ground or lower than tree line stayed about 50 to 75 ft above tree line then moved east then came back and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: It was about 9:00 at night i got out of my car and looked over and saw a bright light. i pulled out my phone and took footage of many objects fling over the mesa and forming a v shape. they then came to a complete stop. i capture this on video on my phone it only records short clips but by the time i could start recording again they moved into a line and then stop then formed together and got really bright then bam they were gone in seconds.
content.summary: Ufo's flying over a mesa

content.detailedDescription: During my vacations the last summer (in chile) and visiting the "colbun lake" (35��� 42' 10.66" s 71��� 20' 28.25" w), near to linares city in chile, just in the middle day, a very warm day, no clouds, no birds, no sounds, it is means a very calm moment, we (my wife and me) were taken photos to the colbun lake from the southern side of lake with north side on view and few minutus later revising the images, appear clearly an objet with a disk shape. at first sight, this object does no look like a plane or bird, is clearly a solid objet floating in the sky, the second photo show the same objet far in the sky, apparently flying to the north.
content.summary: Disk shape object appear on photo.

content.detailedDescription: I was in the second story of my house, master bathroom which is full of sky lights and windows. the bathroom over looks the back yard. up in the sky i saw a blinking light that at first could have been what seemed like an airplane. the only thing is the light did not move. it kept blinking and was stationary and it was only 1 single white light. airplanes and helicopters usually have more lights and move. when i first noticed it, it seemed to be two blinking white lights - one to the left and one to the right - and they never were 'on' or 'lit' at the same time. (almost like either two objects or maybe a large object with a light first blinking on the right side then a light blinking on the left side.) i kept looking at it and then it was only one blinking light and it did not move. i went to the bathroom, came back and looked at it and it was still there blinking in same spot. i compared it to a tree branch to make sure it wasn't moving and it wasn't. it remained in the same location respective the tree branch. i was curious and searched for my shoes and was going to go out side to get a better look. i put my shoes on and went back to the window and it was gone. i went out side and didn't see it anymore.
content.summary: Blinking light mechanical looking hovered outside window.

content.detailedDescription:
I work for a septic company. we have a dump site in desdemona, where we dump septic in a field, fully authorized. back to the story. i worked late that day, up around possum kingdom. i had a septic to do at 7 am the next morning. so i was emptying my septic truck after dark, approx 7:25pm i pulled into the field and was turning my truck around to empty it, and i noticed that venus was really bright. once i got my truck situated i looked back into the sky and saw venus on the northern side of me. i looked back to where i saw "venus" the first time and there was nothing. i chalked it up to being tired and started to empty my truck. that's when i glanced back and saw at least three orange round lights in the sky. they were  just above the horizon to the south, flashing/blinking on and off in a distinct pattern. i looked across the horizon on the other side of me, at the wind turbines. they have red lights that flash at night. the patterns were similar. i looked back at the "freaky lights." they had went from three lights to four lights in a line. i called my wife, freaking out. the lights were taking turns turning on and off. then they "developed" a tail. a fifth, possibly sixth light appeared and made a tail, similar to a kite tail. a 45 degree angle more like. so in all there were up to six lights, in the shape of a triangle. the tip pointing south/south west. 

the whole event that i witnessed lasted maybe 3-4 minutes. i looked at my phone it was 7:25. i stayed in the field watching the skies for about 10 more minutes. then i drove the 20 miles back to stephenville, parked my truck and came home. the next day there were reports in the paper about the freaky lights in desdemona. i reported two days later to the local newspaper, empire tribune. this was thursday night of february fifth. 

several people reported seeing the lights from hwy 108. i was just off of hwy 16, some 25-30 miles west. i believe i saw the formation from the other side. at least i saw it from a different angle/ perspective. 



sorry i waited so long to report to you. i did not feel comfortable to write about it. 


1. i was in desdemona, 20 miles west of stephenville. i was 3 miles north of desdemona on hwy 16. i was on county road 509.

2. i first noticed it cause it was bright.

3. i first thought it was venus.

4. see story.

5. scared [cms/tg/pd], ask my wife.

6. the object just stopped flashing on and off.
content.summary: Large bright light in southern sky, at an south/south west heading.

content.detailedDescription:
For the third time in about 3 weeks, i've seen a star-like object in the middle of the day over la. today i saw it in the same area of the sky where i first saw it a couple of weeks ago. it looks like venus only it's sunny and bright out and the object moves slowly and appears to hover and then moves slowly. twice i've seen in from my neighborhood of montecito heights in the nw sky over la. it's either very high up or very small - i can't tell which. the first time i thought it was a balloon, but it moves too intentionally, and i saw it today in the same area of the sky. i watched both times for about 15 minutes while walking my dogs, and then lost sight of it behind trees in my hilly area. both times i relocated it in a different area and it appears dimmer and less bright and very hard to see. i can see airplanes flying in hte sky near it, but can't tell which is higher. the second time i saw a similar object in the morning over hollywood - my 6 yr old son saw it first, along with three commercial airplanes -one of which he referred to as a "rocketship" b/c it was leaving very visible contrail and appeared to be "going up" from our vantage point. he pointed them out and said "not the white thing in the sky - "the rocketship" sure enough, there was the star-like thing again - this time looking more white than "bright". it appeared stationary and appeared to be higher than the plane my son was watching. this object was a little larger than the star-like ones i saw.  we watched it for about 5 min. until we lost it while driving.

there is a fourth object that both me and my son saw about 6 weeks ago over glendale while driving about an hour before sunset. there were huge, puffy clouds in the sky, and he saw - and then i saw a small, round metallic looking object hovering in hte sky. there was a large cloud behind it so it popped out as being grayish/metallic. a traffic copter flew towards us and was considerable lower than this object. i asked my son "what is that?!!" he said he didn't know. i tried to pull over to get a better look, but it disappeared. it was larger than a star, but still pretty small. it looked totally round - like a ball. my son seemed a little upset and didn't want to talk about it, and i didn't want to upset him.

i've never had experiences like these before - never seen anything out of the ordinary. in all cases, i kept telling myself, these things are balloons. but i've seen them too often - esp the two star-like ones. my husband thinks i'm nuts. i keep thinking these are some kind of surveillance system.
content.summary: Daytime star-like object seen 3 times over la.
